# Student guest speakers

<div id="marlee-alvino"></div>

<table>

It’s safe to say there’s a space here for everyone, and she is excited to share it with you!

## Kate Halushka
<div id="kate-halushka"></div>

<table>
  <tr>
    <td width="70%">
      **Kate** is a senior majoring in computer science and has been coding since high school! Throughout her time at GW, she has been a TA for 3 different CS classes, held leadership positions in multiple orgs, and studied abroad in London. She is currently co-chair of [**WiCS** (_Women in Computer Science_)](https://gwwics.github.io/) at GW. She has also completed 2 summer internships, and is a member of **Sigma Delta Tau**. She’s excited to share how she has taken advantage of the opportunities available in CS at GW!

      **Email**: <a href="mailto:khalushka@gwmail.gwu.edu">khalushka@gwmail.gwu.edu</a>

## Josie Libbon
<div id="josie-lisbon"></div>

<table>
  <tr>
    <td width="70%">
      **Josie** is a senior majoring in computer science and minoring in political science. Throughout her time at GW, she has been an LA and TA for 3 different CS classes, held leadership positions in orgs such as [**WiCS**](https://gwwics.github.io/) and **ACM**, and conducted research with various professors surrounding real-time artificial intelligence. She is currently the undergraduate representative for the CS Curriculum Committee at GW. She has also completed a summer internship at a DMV government contractor, and will be returning there after she graduates in May. She is excited to discuss and give advice on how to have a successful career at GW!
      
      **Email**: <a href="mailto:josielibbon@gwmail.gwu.edu">josielibbon@gwmail.gwu.edu</a>
